intro: Ledermanniella boumiensis, commonly known as the Boumiensis Ledermanniella, is a rare and enigmatic plant species native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the wet season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
